main_definition: The chairman is the person who presides over a meeting or committee, often in an official capacity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A leader of a group or organization, especially one with formal authority.
meanings_and_examples.example: John Smith was elected as the chairman of the local community board.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The head of an assembly, such as a meeting of members or directors.
meanings_and_examples.example: During the annual general meeting, the chairman ensured that all agenda items were covered efficiently.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who chairs a committee or board within an organization.
meanings_and_examples.example: The school's finance committee was chaired by Mr. Anderson, the principal's advisor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In some cases, used to refer specifically to the head of a university's governing body or council.
meanings_and_examples.example: Professor Johnson served as the chairman of the board at his alma mater for over a decade.
